snippet: Seemingly everyone who passed a lot on Park Avenue and 126th Street knew Baruba I. Dahomey, who lived there in a trailer, but nobody really knew him.
abstract: Longtime Harlem squatter Baruba I Dahomey is remembered by neighbors and others who regularly walked past the cluttered lot where he lived; Dahomey died of natural causes early in November, and while many recognized him as neighborhood fixture, few knew very much about him.
lead_paragraph: Seemingly everyone who passed a lot on Park Avenue and 126th Street knew Baruba I. Dahomey, who lived there in a trailer, but nobody really knew him.

headline.main: Neighbors Mourn Harlem Squatter, Known Widely but Not Well
headline.print_headline: A Squatter in Harlem, Known Widely but Not Well
